Issues.Title: Unable to resize `PictureBox` control at runtime in designer - DemoConsole
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

Main branch.

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Not tested/verified

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Yes. We had a similar issue previously and fixed it in #8522

### Issue description

From #9411:

I cannot change the size of the picturebox control in the designer workspace, but can resize it through the properties window.

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/104609169/0a5c9320-1638-42d4-a390-54fe6794085f

_Originally posted by @Nora-Zhou01 in https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/9411#issuecomment-1617719621_
            

### Steps to reproduce

Run DemoConsole and resize picture box.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Unable to resize `PictureBox` control at runtime in designer - DemoConsole" (#9416)

Issues.Title: Moving the SplitContainer splitter size at runtime crashes the DemoConsole application.
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.Net 8.0 SDK: 8.0.100-preview.7.23328.8

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No, This is the new SplitContainer integration test added to the DemoConsole application.

### Issue description

In Winforms repo, there has a [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) test app, the DemoConsole application crashes when moving the SplitContainer splitter size in .Net 8.0. But build and run the application in Release and Debug modes gives different results.

**Release mode：**

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/104609169/feef2f95-dd97-4f11-af12-3eb88433ac91

**Debug mode:**


https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/104609169/62268dd9-7457-4224-8e33-f5d50eefa4d8

**Call stack:**
System.StackOverflowException
  HResult=0x800703E9
  Message=Exception of type 'System.StackOverflowException' was thrown.


### Steps to reproduce

Test sample: [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) in Winforms repo

### More Info

1. Resizing other controls or forms in the DemoConsole application also crashes.
2. Probably caused by the PR [9364](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/9364)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Moving the SplitContainer splitter size at runtime crashes the DemoConsole application." (#9410)

Issues.Title: Fix stack overflow in BehaviorServiceAdornerCollectionEnumerator
Issues.Body:
Fixes #9410 - The parameter must be cast first before calling `GetEnumerator`.
Repeated frames:
```
System.Windows.Forms.Design.dll!System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorServiceAdornerCollectionEnumerator.BehaviorServiceAdornerCollectionEnumerator(System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorServiceAdornerCollection mappings) Line 13	C#
 	System.Windows.Forms.Design.dll!System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorServiceAdornerCollection.GetEnumerator() Line 217	C#
System.Windows.Forms.Design.dll!System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorServiceAdornerCollectionEnumerator.BehaviorServiceAdornerCollectionEnumerator(System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorServiceAdornerCollection mappings) Line 15	C#
 	[The 2 frame(s) above this were repeated 9584 times]	
```

Caused by #9341

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/9411)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Fix stack overflow in BehaviorServiceAdornerCollectionEnumerator" (#9411)

Issues.Title: An exception popped up when click "Type Here" on ContextMenuStrip control in DemoConsole application
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 8.0.100-preview.7.23330.16

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

It also repro's in .NET 7.0.

### Issue description

In Winforms repo, there has a [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) test app, System.NullReferenceException: 'Object reference not set to an instance of an object.' occurs when click "Type Here" on ContextMenuStrip control in DemoConsole application.

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/94418985/4ae6cb77-9592-41ae-96df-65fe24d9241b

![menu-1](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/94418985/d9a6ef8a-76fc-4638-9ddd-8fa88128324f)

**Call Stack:**
System.NullReferenceException
  HResult=0x80004003
  Message=Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
  Source=System.Windows.Forms.Design
  StackTrace:
   at System.Windows.Forms.Design.ToolStripMenuItemDesigner.InitializeDropDown() in C:\test\winforms\src\System.Windows.Forms.Design\src\System\Windows\Forms\Design\ToolStripMenuItemDesigner.cs:line 1618


### Steps to reproduce

Test sample: [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) in Winforms repo
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "An exception popped up when click "Type Here" on ContextMenuStrip control in DemoConsole application" (#9413)

Issues.Title: System.NullReferenceException: 'Object reference not set to an instance of an object.' occurs when delete button control then click undo in DemoConsole application
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 8.0.100-preview.7.23330.16

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Yes, it doesn't reproduce in .NET 7.0.

### Issue description

In Winforms repo, there has a [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) test app, System.NullReferenceException: 'Object reference not set to an instance of an object.' occurs when delete button control then click undo.
In .NET8.0:

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/94418985/f90cc598-5b3a-4eec-aa36-eaa601feda53

![undo-1](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/94418985/43dd7cf6-68e7-4144-80df-097376ddc23c)

**Call Stack:**
System.NullReferenceException
  HResult=0x80004003
  Message=Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
  Source=System.Windows.Forms.Design
  StackTrace:
   at System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.ResourceCodeDomSerializer.SerializationResourceManager.GetMetadataEnumerator() in C:\test\winforms\src\System.Windows.Forms.Design\src\System\ComponentModel\Design\Serialization\ResourceCodeDomSerializer.SerializationResourceManager.cs:line 304

In .NET 7.0:

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/94418985/fa1d1fc2-b802-4e08-af7f-cc7f8d21b920




### Steps to reproduce

Test sample: [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) in Winforms repo
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "System.NullReferenceException: 'Object reference not set to an instance of an object.' occurs when delete button control then click undo in DemoConsole application" (#9412)

Issues.Title: Failed to launch design tools server process process
Issues.Body:
### Environment

Microsoft Visual Studio Community 2022 (64 bits) - Current
Version 17.6.4

### .NET version

net 6.0

### Did this work in a previous version of Visual Studio and/or previous .NET release?

_No response_

### Issue description

I can't open forms since today. I did no update. I tried to reinstall Visual Studio Community but it did nothing.
See errors log in diagnostics


### Steps to reproduce

Just opening a form by double clicking on it from the projet browser and it never loads.

### Diagnostics

```text
> [13:36:08.925333] fail: [Dumbow2]: Failed to launch design tools server process process
                        System.PlatformNotSupportedException: Access Control List (ACL) APIs are part of resource management on Windows and are not supported on this platform.
                           at System.Security.AccessControl.AuthorizationRule..ctor(IdentityReference identity, Int32 accessMask, Boolean isInherited, InheritanceFlags inheritanceFlags, PropagationFlags propagationFlags)
                           at System.Security.AccessControl.AccessRule..ctor(IdentityReference identity, Int32 accessMask, Boolean isInherited, InheritanceFlags inheritanceFlags, PropagationFlags propagationFlags, AccessControlType type)
                           at System.IO.Pipes.NamedPipeServerStream.Create(String pipeName, PipeDirection direction, Int32 maxNumberOfServerInstances, PipeTransmissionMode transmissionMode, PipeOptions options, Int32 inBufferSize, Int32 outBufferSize, PipeSecurity pipeSecurity, HandleInheritability inheritability, PipeAccessRights additionalAccessRights)
                           at System.IO.Pipes.NamedPipeServerStream..ctor(String pipeName, PipeDirection direction, Int32 maxNumberOfServerInstances, PipeTransmissionMode transmissionMode, PipeOptions options)
                           at Microsoft.DotNet.DesignTools.Server.Program.<>c__DisplayClass2_0.<<Main>b__1>d.MoveNext()

                        Pour plus d’informations sur la résolution des problèmes du concepteur, consultez le guide sur https://aka.ms/winforms/designer/troubleshooting.
[13:38:07.920584] fail: [Dumbow2]: Timed out while connecting to named pipe: DesignToolsServer.4c7fc87a-f873-4634-b66c-1cbf54f16c30

                        Pour plus d’informations sur la résolution des problèmes du concepteur, consultez le guide sur https://aka.ms/winforms/designer/troubleshooting.
[13:38:07.929585] fail: Microsoft.DotNet.DesignTools.Client.ServerException: Expiration du délai d’attente lors de la connexion au canal nommé.
                           à Microsoft.DotNet.DesignTools.Client.Host.ServerProcess.<ConnectToStreamAsync>d__35.MoveNext()
                        --- Fin de la trace de la pile à partir de l'emplacement précédent au niveau duquel l'exception a été levée ---
                           à System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
                           à System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
                           à Microsoft.DotNet.DesignTools.Client.Host.ServerProcess.<LaunchAsync>d__28.MoveNext()
                        --- Fin de la trace de la pile à partir de l'emplacement précédent au niveau duquel l'exception a été levée ---
                           à System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
                           à System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
                           à Microsoft.DotNet.DesignTools.Client.Host.ServerHostFactory.<CreateHostAsync>d__8.MoveNext()
                        --- Fin de la trace de la pile à partir de l'emplacement précédent au niveau duquel l'exception a été levée ---
                           à System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
                           à System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
                           à Microsoft.DotNet.DesignTools.Client.DesignToolsClientLoader.<CreateClientAsync>d__29.MoveNext()

                        Pour plus d’informations sur la résolution des problèmes du concepteur, consultez le guide sur https://aka.ms/winforms/designer/troubleshooting.
[13:38:08.584013] warn: Cannot update selection in server process as Session is not connected.
[13:38:08.687016] warn: Cannot update selection in server process as Session is not connected.
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Failed to launch design tools server process process" (#9401)

Issues.Title: Update control owning field of TextBox to using weak reference(#9224)
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Related to #9224 


## Proposed changes

- Update the control owning field of TextBox  to using weak references
- Enable the GC collect test for the TextBox  control in unit test cases


<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- The strong reference used by the original Owner property can cause a memory leak

## Regression? 

-  No


<!-- end TELL-MODE -->



## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- Unit tests
 

## Test environment(s) <!-- Remove any that don't apply -->

- dotnet 8.0.0-preview.7.23328.11


<!-- Mention language, UI scaling, or anything else that might be relevant -->

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/9397)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "[main] Update dependencies from dotnet/runtime" (#9397)

Issues.Title: TreeView custom sort fails if TreeNode has child nodes
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 8.0.100-preview.7.23328.11

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Yes.
Regression after PR [#9078](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/9078)

### Issue description

`TreeView.TreeViewNodeSorter` instance is supposed to compare `TreeNode` objects, as described in [documentation](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.windows.forms.treeview.treeviewnodesorter?view=windowsdesktop-7.0):
> Gets or sets the implementation of IComparer to perform a custom sort of the TreeView nodes.

After PR #9078 TreeViewNodeSorter receives tree node text instead of the tree node itself, when sorting non-top level nodes.

Example from the [documentation](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.windows.forms.treeview.treeviewnodesorter?view=windowsdesktop-7.0#examples) throws `NullReferenceException`:
![nullreferenceexception_treeview_custom_sorting](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/113603457/f9d6e770-8de3-4436-9062-d28dbf9bb33b)


### Steps to reproduce

1. Install .NET 8.0.100-preview.7.23328.11 or older
2. Create a Windows Form App (.NET) project and copy the code from [documentation example](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.windows.forms.treeview.treeviewnodesorter?view=windowsdesktop-7.0#examples) or open the [sample app](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/11903966/ScratchProject.zip)
3. Run the app and click "Set Sorter" button.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "TreeView custom sort fails if TreeNode has child nodes" (#9394)

Issues.Title: Fixed TreeView custom sorting failure when TreeNode has child nodes
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #9394


### Changes

- Fix using of `TreeViewNodeSorter.Compare` method: compare tree nodes, not nodes' `Text` values.
- Add a unit test to ensure TreeNodes are compared while sorting TreeView.

Issues.Title: The GridView's columns display incorrectly when setting PropertyGrid's selectedObject to GridView and slide the scrollbar in DataGridViewColumn Collection Editor dialog
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.Net 8.0 SDK: 8.0.100-preview.7.23328.8

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Not tested/verified

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Yes, cannot repro in .Net 6.0 and Net 7.0.

### Issue description

When setting PropertyGrid's selectedObject to GridView with Columns, open DataGridViewColumn Collection Editor dialog in propertyGrid, use the mouse to slide the scrollbar left and right to observe the Columns, the GridView's columns display incorrectly.
The issue also can repro in ListView control.

**.Net 8.0 result:**
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/56664234/5fab052a-5b5d-4d71-a5d3-c3aa015c66b6)

**.Net 7.0/.Net 6.0**
When using the mouse to slide the scrollbar left and right, the GridView's columns display correctly.
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/56664234/a3124009-9b1d-4de5-8b67-08281b89486e)


### Steps to reproduce

Use following sample application:
[WinFormsApp9.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/11903662/WinFormsApp9.zip)

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/56664234/a9324606-f2c2-4d4a-aa9d-44cc98f82ca9
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "The GridView's columns display incorrectly when setting PropertyGrid's selectedObject to GridView and slide the scrollbar in DataGridViewColumn Collection Editor dialog " (#9392)

Issues.Title: [Accessibility] Narrator doesn't announce number before Hyphen/Colon while deleting number in MaskedTextBox
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 8.0.100-preview.7.23328.8 

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No

Narrator doesn't announce all of numbers in MaskedTextBox while deleting numbers in .NET 6.0, 7.0 and .NET Framework.

### Issue description

1. Narrator doesn't announce numbers before Hypen/Colon while deleting numbers in MaskedTextBox

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/130345015/dec9afe2-1dec-4659-a4b4-debebf882ea5

2. It works well in NVDA for NET 6.0, 7.0, 8.0 and Framework. NVDA announce all of numbers while deleting numbers in MaskedTextBox.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Start a Winforms .Net Core application with MaskedTextBox
2. Set Mask as Data format with Hyphen/Colon (e.g MobilePhoneNumber)
3. Run app (F5)
4. Open Narrator
5. Input 12 digits number in MaskedTextBox
6. Delete number
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Accessibility] Narrator doesn't announce number before Hyphen/Colon while deleting number in MaskedTextBox" (#9391)

Issues.Title: Fix the next position is not correct when toolstrip using mouse or ke…
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #9181 
Tracing the behavior described in the bug, we find that when calling the GetNextItemHorizontal() method, their input parameters are the same, which caused that, although we clicked on different buttons Left/Right, the behavior of the control is the same.
## Proposed changes

- Add a parameter with default value to GetNextItemHorizontal() method to distinguish Left/Right.
- Add a default parameter to the GetStartItem() method to return the expected ToolStripItem.
- Tweak the code so that the correct selected item is found.

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- When typing Left/Right keyboard, the next focus position will be the next item, not the first item on the Left/ Right.

## Regression? 

-  No

## Risk

-

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->


## Screenshots <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

### Before

![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/133954995/3349faa9-f1dc-4a8a-9e52-61de9ac48481)

### After

![ToolStrip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/133954995/3dbdf10e-012b-4b22-a653-9d96b1fcc7e7)




## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- Manual

## Accessibility testing  <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

<!--
     Microsoft prioritizes making our products accessible. 
     WinForms has a key role in allowing developers to create accessible apps. 
     
     When submitting a change which impacts UI in any way, including adding new UI or
     modifying existing controls the developer needs to run the Accessibility Insights
     tool (https://accessibilityinsights.io/) and verify that there are no changes or
     regressions. 
     
     The developer should run the Fast Pass over the impacted control(s) and provide
     a snapshot of the passing results along with before/after snapshots of the UI.
     More info: (https://accessibilityinsights.io/docs/en/web/getstarted/fastpass)
  -->


 

## Test environment(s) <!-- Remove any that don't apply -->

- 8.0.0-preview.7.23323.5


<!-- Mention language, UI scaling, or anything else that might be relevant -->

Issues.Title: PropertyGrid cannot get the ComboBox's items when setting PropertyGrid's selectedObject to ComboBox
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.Net 8.0 SDK: 8.0.100-preview.7.23328.8

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Yes, cannot repro in .Net 6.0. Regression from .Net 7.0.

### Issue description

When setting PropertyGrid's selectedObject to ComboBox, open String Collection Editor dialog in propertyGrid, there is nothing displayed for added items in ComboBox.
Cannot repro in other controls: ListBox/CheckedListBox.

**.Net 8.0/.Net 7.0 result:**
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/26474449/f1f40896-9565-4d09-8fe9-f1dc85657dab)

**.Net 6.0 result:**
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/26474449/7518c0c8-1dc8-4063-a345-8bcce876981e)


### Steps to reproduce

Use following sample application:
[WinFormsApp53.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/11902593/WinFormsApp53.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "PropertyGrid cannot get the ComboBox's items when setting PropertyGrid's selectedObject to ComboBox" (#9389)

Issues.Title: Dependency updates
Issues.Body:
Review commit-by-commit highly recommended.
Merge commit (without squash) strongly suggested.

Supersedes #9372

* Update StyleCop.Analyzers to 1.2.0-beta.507 (no changes necessary)
* Update Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.NetAnalyzers to 8.0.0-preview.23327.3 and fix newly reported diagnostics
* Update Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Analyzers to 3.3.5-beta1.23327.3 and fix newly reported diagnostics (including migration of EnumValidationGenerator to IIncrementalGenerator)
* Update Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Testing to 1.1.2-beta1.23322.1 and update implementation to account for code changes
